A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This movie is a return to form for the franchise. Star Wars is sci-fi/fantasy and like all great art of that genre it delivers a powerful theme and pushes against conventions. The original films did that very well. As much as I liked The Force Awakens\, it didn't make me think or challenge my expectations. The Last Jedi does the exact opposite - and it's very refreshing. The movie uses the sci-fi/fantasy lens to tell a great story about the grey moral universe we live in and to celebrate the democratic nature of true heroism. All this is done while developing three-dimensional characters and delivering some truly great action and stunning plot twists. We need more great sci-fi/fantasy like this that pushes us away from the easy hero worship and simple good versus evil plots of recent sci-fi and fantasy movies.
